body:
@rafaelfranca - I think I've been missing your point: you're advocating (I think) that there not be a type-specific accessor at all, but an implementation of the question-mark method for *all* stored attributes. I'm pushing for a syntax that simplifies the (IMHO) common case of storing booleans in a store.

What are your thoughts (or other core devs) on the general principle of providing more type information for `store_accessor` attributes? For instance, a corresponding `store_integer_accessor` or passing types via a hash (`store_accessor :some_store_attribute, foo: :integer, bar: :boolean`, hypothetically).
